title: Djokovic jokes that he's challenging Serena Williams to come back to tennis
description: Novak Djokovic thinks he came up with a way to get Serena Williams back on the tennis tour: Dare her to do it
content:
Then he turned his thoughts to Williams, she of the 23 Grand Slam singles titles, one fewer than Djokovic’s total.

Williams left tennis after playing at the 2022 U.S. Open, saying at the time she preferred to think of herself as “evolving” away from the sport rather than retiring.

“Of course, seeing Serena in any shape or form around tennis is great. You know, we miss her,” Djokovic said, then added with a wry smile: “She still hasn’t officially retired.”

And then he added: “So I invite her. I challenge her. Because she’s such a great competitor, when somebody challenges her, she never refuses. So I challenge Serena: Come back on the tour next year.”

Williams turns 44 next month. Her older sister, Venus, who is 45, will be playing in a Grand Slam tournament for the first time in two years at the U.S. Open on Monday night, after returning to the tour in July.
summary: Serbian tennis player, Novak Djokovic, has challenged Serena Williams to return to the sport, stating that she still hasn't officially retired from the sport. This comes as she turns 44 next month. The comments were made in reference to Williams' 23 Grand Slam singles titles, one of which she holds more than one of the world's highest.
shortSummary: Novak Djokovic challenges Serena Williams to return to tennis, citing her readiness as well as her age.
argos_summary: Novak Djokovic has challenged Serena Williams to return to the tennis tour next year, noting that she has not officially retired despite stepping away after the 2022 U.S. Open. He praised her competitive spirit and expressed excitement at seeing her on the court again. The article also mentions that Serena’s 44th birthday is coming up and that her sister Venus, now 45, will compete in her first Grand Slam in two years at the U.S. Open.
